5 Incredible Ways Enterprises Can Use Big Data Technology

Where is the future of data technology headed? With these steps, you can keep your business on the cutting edge.

Sawaram Suthar March 1, 2018 March 2, 2018
43 Shares 6,739 Views
  • Share on Facebook
  • Tweet on Twitter
  • +
Shutterstock Licensed Photo - By garagestock

The concept of big data revolves around the global information revolution of the past few decades. Today, data-driven businesses are largely dependent on information collected from every domain in the industry, from customer requirements, to product specifications, to survey data, and so on. Businesses all over the world are keen on integrating big data into their platforms in an innovative way.

The volume of data produced in cyberspace is exponentially growing. With more than 2.7 zetabytes of data in the digital world today, we are facing an information overload. Thanks to big data analysis, companies are able to use this information any way they like. From marketing to product distribution, data can leverage your business in many ways.

When you sell your products, your marketing strategy is streamlined by informed decisions. As businesses have realized the importance of technology in recent years, the big data industry has witnessed massive investments. In 2018, companies across the globe are likely to invest more than $57 billion on these technologies. Here are five incredible ways that you can use big data technology in your business.

Modern Product Distribution

The ability to evaluate large volumes of data quickly makes big data technology ideal for distributing products in today’s business landscape. From warehouses to loading bays, big data can significantly improve the process of modern product distribution. The speed and efficiency of these technologies is key. This is a cost-effective way to streamline your distribution process. Depending on the industry, those in charge of product distribution can optimize this process to varying degrees by integrating big data technologies.

The shipping process for firms, particularly e-Commerce companies, can be leveraged through these technologies as well. Today, developers have created strategic big data tools that enable businesses to load trucks based on their delivery sequence, increasing efficiency. For instance, the goods that are supposed to be delivered last are loaded at the beginning. This eliminates the hassles of unloading and reloading products over and over again.

As a result, the risk of damage to the products during delivery is significantly reduced, while the delivery speed is increased.

Identifying Trends

The dynamic environment of digitized business needs to be monitored to identify popular trends. Big data technologies are able to efficiently spot and monitor customers’ patterns of behavior. This enables them to make essential predictions that lead to strategic decisions by businesses, putting them on the right track.

By integrating these technologies, companies can identify a change in demand for certain products or services over time. The advanced versions can yield very precise results, eliminating guesswork from the planning process.

Big data has greatly strengthened the analytics market. At the end of 2017, the business intelligence and analytics market was believed to be worth $18.3 billion. Today, the trending issues across Facebook, Twitter, and other social media platforms often mold the marketing strategies of businesses everywhere.

Improving Operations

Competition has always been a part of business. Big data technologies enable businesses to evaluate the competitive scenario and determine their position in the industry. These innovations have opened up previously unexplored channels of understanding when it comes to the competition, going far beyond what is on rivals’ websites, or circulating as gossip in the industry. Big data technologies can easily assess the financial data available online and help you gain insight into the success of your competitors.

It is easy to assess customer feedback on brands, as information is abundantly available in cyberspace. Google Trends can illustrate the popularity of various products, while you can compare all the information gathered to your own brand. Competitors’ data has never been easier to assess.

Based on this, you need to optimize your business process. Through big data analysis, businesses can benefit from the real-time visibility of operations, and increase their efficiency.

Tweaking A Business Model

The business environment is always changing. Big data can help you modernize your business model, integrating the necessary changes, and improving productivity. The business environment is competitive, and you need to tweak certain strategic elements from time to time to stay current.

READ
AI Streamlines Content Curation Strategies In Digital Marketing

Take Facebook, for instance. It is free for users and gathers valuable data about their tastes through analytics. This data is available for advertising on the platform, which generates massive revenues. Small businesses can monetize this data by providing valuable services to third-party companies, using big data.

Today, around 44% of B2C marketers are using big data to increase their businesses’ responsiveness.

Understanding Customer Behavior

Understanding customer behavior hinges on the analytics you incorporate into your business. Because of the competitive business environment, it is necessary to cater to the needs of your customers in a personalized way. Evaluating your customers’ behavior is critical today, as is integrating big data technologies on your platform. They provide a seamless way to assess the needs of customers.

There are a lot of novel ways that companies can get more information on their customers. Using a reverse phone lookup is one of the most revolutionary.

Accurate data analysis helps firms get a better idea of what their customers want. Companies are integrating these technologies across the board to get a handle on the tastes of their customers.

Companies can learn their preferred shopping methods through feedback and other sources, evaluating their clients’ requirements. Evaluating important sources of data, like sales information, customer service logs, public data sets, and text analytics offers companies valuable insights.

Conclusion

The volume of information in the digitized world is increasing every day. Big data analysis can help your business understand the demands of the market and act accordingly. Reach out to the leading platforms, which are known for their expertise in big data analysis. From marketing to after-sales services, big data technology can improve your business.
